place.name: LLANGAR
place.gazetteerText: LLANGAR, a township and a parish in Corwen district, Merioneth. The township lies on the river Dee, at the influx of the Alwen, 1½ mile SW of Corwen r. station. The parish contains also the townships of Bryn, Cymmer, and Gwynod; and its Post town is Corwen. Acres, 3,578. Real property, £1,908; of which £90 are in quarries. Pop., 211. Houses, 43. Much of the land is waste. Traces of an ancient fort are at Caerwern. The living is a rectory, united with the chapelry of Cynwyd, in the diocese of St. Asaph. Value, £160. * Pa tron, the Bishop of St. Asaph. The parish shares in the charities of Corwen. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
